title: 'Not now, Bernard' and other stories by David McKee
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Literature/Children's literature - Film and video adaptations
description: Episode of Series "Anytime tales". Five delightfully entertaining tales with unexpected twists are captivatingly told in this selection of animated stories written by David McKee. "Not now, Bernard": Bernard's parents are always far too busy to listen to him, even when he tries to tell them that a monster is going to eat him. "Elmer": the story of a very special elephant called Elmer. "The Sad story of Veronica who played the violin": Veronica is determined to play the violin so she practices day and night until she plays so beautifully that everyone cries. "The Hill and the rock": a very strange chain of events begins when Mr. Quest removes the rock from outside his kitchen window. "Two can Toucan": a little black bird with no name is ridiculed by all the other jungle animals.
